alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued January 15 at 3:52PM EST until January 17 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM SUNDAY TO 10 AM EST MONDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 8 to 12 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Watch, two to three feet of inundation above ground level possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Bayside of Accomack County for the Coastal Flood Watch, Atlantic side of Accomack County for the High Surf Advisory. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 7 PM Sunday to 10 AM EST Monday. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from Sunday evening through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. NASSAWADOX CREEK AT BAYFORD VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 3.0 FT, MODERATE 3.5 FT, MAJOR 4.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.0 FT, MODERATE 1.5 FT, MAJOR 2.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 15/08 PM 2.1 0.1 0.8 2-3 NONE 16/09 AM 2.8 0.8 1.0 3 NONE 16/09 PM 3.2 1.2 1.9 4-5 MINOR 17/09 AM 3.2 1.2 1.4 5 MINOR 17/10 PM 1.7 -0.3 0.3 4 NONE 18/10 AM 1.7 -0.3 -0.1 2 NONE CHINCOTEAGUE INLET VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 6.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.2 FT, MAJOR 3.2 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 15/06 PM 3.1 0.3 1.3 1 NONE 16/07 AM 4.2 1.4 1.5 1-2 NONE 16/07 PM 3.9 1.1 2.0 2-3 NONE 17/08 AM 3.8 1.0 1.0 2 NONE 17/08 PM 2.4 -0.4 0.4 2 NONE 18/08 AM 2.7 -0.1 -0.1 1 NONE SAXIS VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.5 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 4.0 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 15/12 PM 2.6 0.1 0.6 2 NONE 15/11 PM 2.6 0.1 0.9 2 NONE 16/11 AM 3.4 0.9 1.1 2 NONE 16/11 PM 3.4 0.9 1.6 3 NONE 17/12 PM 5.7 3.2 3.3 4 MODERATE 18/12 AM 3.2 0.7 1.4 4 NONE WACHAPREAGUE VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 6.5 FT, MODERATE 7.5 FT, MAJOR 8.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 3.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 15/07 PM 5.2 0.7 1.8 1 NONE 16/07 AM 6.1 1.6 1.7 1 NONE 16/08 PM 6.5 2.0 3.0 1 MINOR 17/08 AM 5.9 1.4 1.5 1 NONE 17/08 PM 3.2 -1.3 -0.3 1 NONE 18/09 AM 3.8 -0.7 -0.6 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
